rekit.logic.level

Class Configurable

  • java.lang.Object
    • rekit.logic.level.Configurable
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Structure, StructureManager, StructureManager.BossSettings

    public abstract class Configurable
extends Object

    Abstract class and interface declaration that supplies defining settings. Each Setting is a mapping from a setting name (of type String) to its corresponding value (of type integer).

    Initially, no setting is set and therefore isSettingSet(String settingName) (as well as getSettingValue(String settingName)) return their default value false (or 0)

    To define settings, use setSetting(String settingName, int settingValue)

    The data structure used to hold these saved settings is entirely managed by this abstract class and therefore private.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Angelo Aracri

    • Constructor Detail

        public Configurable()

    • Method Detail

      • setSetting

        public void setSetting(String settingName,
                       String value)
        Sets a setting of name settingName to the given value settingValue. If this setting was defined beforehand, the old value will be overwritten (classic Map-behavior).
        Parameters:
        settingName - The name of the setting to set/overwrite
        value - The new value for the setting

      • isSettingSet

        public boolean isSettingSet(String settingName)
        Determines if a setting of a given settingName is defined and not 0.
        Parameters:
        settingName - the name of the setting to check.
        Returns:
        true if the setting is defined and not 0, false otherwise.

      • getSettingValue

        public String getSettingValue(String settingName)
        Returns the value of the setting of a given settingName or 0´null if it is not defined.
        Parameters:
        settingName - the name of the setting to get the value from.
        Returns:
        the value of the setting if defined, null otherwise.
